liam.collections

Class Deck<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • liam.collections.Deck<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of items to be added.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<T>, java.util.Collection<T>

    public class Deck<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Collection<T>
    This class acts like a deck of cards (not to be confused with the Deque class which is a double-ended queue). The items stored in this class can be placed on and fetched from the top, the middle randomly or the bottom. The items can also be shuffled.
    Author:
    Liam

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Deck()
      This constructor will create an empty deck.
      Deck(java.util.List<? extends T> items)
      This constructor will create a deck with initial items.

      • placeMiddle

        public void placeMiddle(java.util.Collection<? extends T> items,
                        boolean isTogether)
        This method will place a list of items somewhere in the middle of the deck. If isTogether is true, the items will be added somewhere in the middle of the deck with the order intact. If it is false, the items will be added to the middle of the deck randomly.
        Parameters:
        items - The items to add to the middle.
        isTogether - Whether the items added will be together.
